- We've had an unbelievable

and we know we're

we like to find people who

in their local community
around food so Ebers and I

went and found some people
who are quite literally
passing it on.
Cafe Reconcile is a nonprofit daytime
restaurant serving Southern staples
cooked by at-risk youth that receive job
training as part of an eight-week program.
- We take them in and generally we
try to take in about 20 kids per class.
We do six cohorts a year and we do
typical restaurant stuff there's pantry,

a hot line, a fryer,
service, bus runners, hosts,

we teach them how to
talk to the customers,

five steps of service we
teach them how to read recipes

even we are teaching
them skills but the main

concept is that let them
work with those soft skills,

when they're mad, how to
work well with others,

how to be on time, that's the
things we are pushing for.
